metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19449 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel 5.0.21, mounting a crafted f2fs filesystem image can lead to slab-out-of-bounds read access in f2fs_build_segment_manager in fs/f2fs/segment.c, related to init_min_max_mtime in fs/f2fs/segment.c (because the second argument to get_seg_entry is not validated). It was discovered that the f2fs file system in the Linux kernel did not properly validate metadata in some situations. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious f2fs image that, when mounted and operated on, could cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19449` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-162-generic - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-4.15.0-162-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-4.15.0-162-lowlatency - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-162-generic - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-162-lowlatency - 4.15.0-162.170
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1115-aws - 4.15.0-1115.122
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1059-aws - 5.4.0-1059.62~18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Exploiting this vulnerability requires a crafted filesystem image to be mounted

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-162.170').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1115.122').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
